column2: Convert directly to a python regular expression (ignore this non technical persons)
column3: Contains items with more than one word
column4: When a lexicon term with more than one word is hit, count that term a number of times equal to the number of words in the term (as opposed to once)
column5: Denotes whether case should be considered
column7: Count letters joined with hyphens as a single word (eg. fleet-footed)
column8: Count letters joined with apostrophes as a single word (eg. can't, Smith's)
column10: Interprets "*" as a wildcard for the rest of the phrase
column11: If checked, will disqualify a word if it's followed/proceeded by anything that isn't normal punctuation and/or whitespace. Will also disqualify ill-capitalized words)
column12: Include words that have in word capitals (ex. McDonald), only relevant for safe modes like OCR Safe
column13: Makes the sentence Part of Speech Sensitive
column14: indicate how the POS is indicated (for instance , if the entry is "smith-N", the convention is: {noun:".*-N", verb:".*-V"})
column15: Tool used to parse POS (ex. Spacy-sm)
